text: The 2017 Minnesota Golden Gophers football team represented the University of Minnesota during the 2017 NCAA Division I FBS football season. The Gophers were led by first-year head coach P.J. Fleck and played their home games at TCF Bank Stadium in Minneapolis, Minnesota. Minnesota competed as a member of the West Division of the Big Ten Conference. They finished the season 5–7, 2–7 in Big Ten play to finish in sixth place in the West Division. ==Recruiting== ===Position key=== {| class="wikitable" |- |Back |B |rowSpan="6" style="background-color:lightgrey;"| |Center |C |rowSpan="6" style="background-color:lightgrey;"| |Cornerback |CB |rowSpan="6" style="background-color:lightgrey;"| |Defensive back |DB |- |Defensive end |DE |Defensive lineman |DL |Defensive tackle |DT |End |E |- |Fullback |FB |Guard |G |Halfback |HB |Kicker |K |- |Kickoff returner |KR |Offensive tackle |OT |Offensive lineman |OL |Linebacker |LB |- |Long snapper |LS |Punter |P |Punt returner |PR |Quarterback |QB |- |Running back |RB |Safety |S |Tight end |TE |Wide receiver |WR |} ===Recruits=== The Gophers signed a total of 26 recruits. ==Schedule== The Gophers' 2017 schedule consisted of 7 home games and 5 away games. Minnesota hosted two of its non-conference games; against Buffalo from the MAC and against Middle Tennessee from Conference USA; the Gophers played on the road against Oregon State from the Pac-12. The Gophers played nine conference games; they hosted Maryland, Michigan State, Illinois, Nebraska, and Wisconsin. They traveled to Purdue, Iowa, and Michigan, and Northwestern. *Sources: ==Game summaries== ===Buffalo=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 1–0 | 2002 | MINN, 41–17 |} ===at Oregon State=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 3–1 | 2016 | MINN, 30–23 |} ===Middle Tennessee=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 2–0 | 2014 | MINN, 35–24 |} ===Maryland=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 1–1 | 2016 | MINN, 31–10 |} ===at Purdue=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 37–32–3 | 2016 | MINN, 44–31 |} ===Michigan State=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 17–29 | 2013 | MSU, 14–3 |} ===Illinois=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 37–29–3 | 2016 | MINN, 40–17 |} ===at Iowa=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 62–46–2 | 2016 | IOWA, 14–7 |} ===at Michigan=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 25–74–3 | 2015 | MICH, 29–26 |} ===Nebraska=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 31–24–2 | 2016 | NEB, 24–17 |} ===at Northwestern=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 53–345 | 2016 | MINN, 29–12 |} ===Wisconsin=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 59–59–8 | 2016 | WISC, 31–17 |} ==Roster== ==References== Minnesota Golden Gophers football Category:Minnesota Golden Gophers football seasons Minnesota Golden Gophers
